column2: Victory. That is the focus of every sermon delivered by the priests in the Hagia Sophia. Roman armies have once more secured Thrace, the heartland of the Eastern Roman Empire. May barbarians never again threaten the City of World's Desire!
Victory. Roman armies have once more secured Thrace, the heartland of the Eastern Roman Empire. May barbarians never again threaten the City of World's Desire!

Moesia Inferior is once more under Roman control, bringing with it control of the mouth of the Danube as well as of a stretch of the coastline of the Black Sea. This province will without doubt be as valuable for Rome in these times as it was in the past.

Moesia Inferior is once more under Roman control, bringing with it control of the mouth of the Danube as well as of a stretch of the coastline of the Black Sea. This province will without doubt be as valuable for Rome in these times as it was in the past.

Moesia Superior is once more under Roman control, securing a strategically important stretch of the Danube. To avoid repeating the mistakes of the past, this region will doubtlessly be well fortified to help protect against any barbarians that might dare to attempt to cross into Roman lands.

Moesia Superior is once more under Roman control, securing a strategically important stretch of the Danube. To avoid repeating the mistakes of the past, this region will doubtlessly be well fortified to help protect against any barbarians that might dare to attempt to cross into Roman lands.

First conquered following the Third Macedonian War, the birthplaces of Alexander the Great is once more under Roman control. History will tell whether it once more gives rise to a great conqueror, but with the province under Roman control such a conqueror would without doubt serve Rome and her interests.

First conquered following the Third Macedonian War, the birthplaces of Alexander the Great is once more under Roman control. History will tell whether it once more gives rise to a great conqueror, but with the province under Roman control such a conqueror would without doubt serve Rome and her interests.

Once the home of King Pyrrhus, who sought to curtail Roman expansion in the Italian Peninsula, and later the site of the Battle of Actium - which saw Augustus himself triumph over Marcus Antonius and Cleopatra VII Philopator, securing the reign of the Princeps - Epirus once again belongs to Rome. This is without doubt a great day for the Roman Empire.

Once the home of King Pyrrhus, who sought to curtail Roman expansion in the Italian Peninsula, and later the site of the Battle of Actium - which saw Augustus himself triumph over Marcus Antonius and Cleopatra VII Philopator, securing the reign of the Princeps - Epirus once again belongs to Rome. This is without doubt a great day for the Roman Empire.

The Greek heartland is once more securely in the hands of Rome. Once one of the most prosperous and peaceful parts of the Roman Empire, only time will tell what the future holds for the region, but it will without doubt benefit Rome.

The Greek heartland is once more securely in the hands of Rome. Once the home of those that sacked Troy and forced Aeneas to flee, the heirs of Romulus once more control the region, and its rich history and culture will without doubt benefit Rome.
The Province of Crete et Cyrenaica

The island of Crete, and the region of Cyrenaica in Africa, are once more under Roman control. Together, they help secure the Eastern Mediterranean from outside threats, and also help facilitate trade between Europe and Africa, both of which are in the interest of Rome.

The island of Crete, and the region of Cyrenaica in Africa, are once more under Roman control. Together, they help secure the Eastern Mediterranean from outside threats, and also help facilitate trade between Europe and Africa, both of which are in the interest of Rome.

The dark times are over for the people of Aegyptus, as Roman rule has been restored to the province once more. The Land of the Pharaohs served well as the breadbasket of the old empire, and it will again become a vital cornerstone in the continued prosperity of the glorious Roman Empire.
column3: La longue période de ténèbres est finie pour le peuple égyptien, car l'autorité romaine règne de nouveau sur le pays. La Terre des Pharaons était le grenier de l'ancien Empire et elle va de nouveau devenir la pierre angulaire de la prospérité du glorieux Empire romain.
column4: Die dunklen Zeiten für die Bewohner von Aegyptus sind beendet, die römische Herrschaft über die Provinz ist wiederhergestellt. Das Land der Pharaonen diente vorzüglich als Kornkammer des alten Reiches, und wird jetzt wieder ein wertvoller Eckpfeiler des andauernden Wohlstands des Imperium Romanum sein.
column6: Para la gente de Aegyptus los tiempos duros ya pasaron, el dominio Romano ha sido reinstaurado, una vez más, para gobernar la provincia. La tierra de los Pharaos fue el granero para el antiguo Imperio, y volverá a ser una piedra angular esencial para la continua prosperidad del glorioso Estado Romano.

column2: The dark times are over for the people of Aegyptus, as Roman rule has been restored to the province once more. The Land of the Pharaohs served well as the breadbasket of the old empire, and it will again become a vital cornerstone in the continued prosperity of the glorious Roman Empire.
column3: La longue période de ténèbres est finie pour le peuple égyptien, car l'autorité romaine règne de nouveau sur le pays. La Terre des Pharaons était le grenier de l'ancien Empire et elle va de nouveau devenir la pierre angulaire de la prospérité du glorieux Empire romain.
column4: Die dunklen Zeiten für die Bewohner von Aegyptus sind beendet, die römische Herrschaft über die Provinz ist wiederhergestellt. Das Land der Pharaonen diente vorzüglich als Kornkammer des alten Reiches, und wird jetzt wieder ein wertvoller Eckpfeiler des andauernden Wohlstands des Imperium Romanum sein.
column6: Para la gente de Aegyptus los tiempos duros ya pasaron, el dominio Romano ha sido reinstaurado, una vez más, para gobernar la provincia. La tierra de los Pharaos fue el granero para el antiguo Imperio, y volverá a ser una piedra angular esencial para la continua prosperidad del glorioso Estado Romano.

column2: Annexed by Trajan and later turned over to the Ghassanid client state, Arabia Petraea was among the first areas outside Arabia proper to face the original Muslim onslaught. Now once more secured by Rome, the region will without doubt be fortified and protected so that it never again falls into the hands of heathens.

Annexed by Trajan and later turned over to the Ghassanid client state, Arabia Petraea was among the first areas outside Arabia proper to face the original Muslim onslaught. Now once more secured by Rome, the region will without doubt be fortified and protected so that it never again slips into the hands of barbarians.

The whole of the ancient province of Syria Palaestina has finally been liberated from the vile clutches of barbarians and restored to the Imperium Romanum. As such, the birthplace of Christ is once more back where it belongs, under proper Roman control.

The whole of the ancient province of Syria Palaestina has finally been liberated from the vile clutches of barbarians and restored to the Imperium Romanum. The Galileans would doubtlessly have preferred for its recovery to have been thanks to the efforts of one of their own, but it seems that is not the will of their god.

Though not technically part of the Roman Empire proper at all times in the past, instead generally being controlled by a Bosporan Kingdom subservient towards Rome, Taurica now indisputably belongs to Rome. This strategic region will doubtlessly benefit the Empire in the future.

Though not technically part of the Roman Empire proper at all times in the past, instead generally being controlled by a Bosporan Kingdom subservient towards Rome, Taurica now indisputably belongs to Rome. This strategic region will doubtlessly benefit the Empire in the future.

The Roman province of Asia, located in the western part of Asia Minor, is once more fully under Roman control. This helps secure the Sea of Marmara and Constantinople itself, which helps secure the Empire as a whole.

The province of Asia is once more under Roman control. Though no sign of the city can be found, it is said that the ancient city of Troy, once the home of Aeneas himself, is located here, and it is only fitting that his heirs control the region.
The Province of Bithynia et Pontus

Veni, vidi, vici. Caesar did not think to write much of his victory against the Kingdom of Pontus, but future historians will doubtlessly have much to say about how Bithynia et Pontus was brought back under Roman control.

Veni, vidi, vici. Caesar did not think to write much of his victory against the Kingdom of Pontus, but future historians will doubtlessly have much to say about how Bithynia et Pontus was brought back under Roman control.
The Province of Lycia et Pamphylia

While not a very large province, Lycia et Pamphylia has been brought back under Roman control, and the province will quite possibly provide useful to the Roman Empire in the future despite its unimpressive size.

Though one of the smaller Roman provinces, Lycia et Pamphylia contains the Mausoleum at Halicarnassus, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, making the reincorporation of the region into the Roman Empire quite an impressive feat.
Controlling a sizeable portion of Anatolia, the province of Galatia has been reclaimed by the resurgent Roman Empire. It is the desire of all true Romans that the province is never lost again.
Controlling a sizeable portion of Anatolia, the province of Galatia has been reclaimed by the resurgent Roman Empire. It is the desire of all true Romans that the province is never lost again.

Once the frontier in the struggle between the Roman Empire and the Umayyad Caliphate, Cilicia is once more firmly under Roman control. There is little doubt that the province will be fortified and garrisoned to prevent it from being lost again in the future.

Once the frontier in the struggle between the Roman Empire and the Umayyad Caliphate, Cilicia is once more firmly under Roman control. There is little doubt that the province will be fortified and garrisoned to prevent it from being lost again in the future.

The Roman Empire once more controls all of Cyprus. While a small province compared to many others, the island is both strategically important as far as controlling the eastern portion of the Mediterranean goes and of great value to the traders of the region, and it would thus be of interest for the Empire to secure it even if it had not been a Roman province in the past.

The Roman Empire once more controls all of Cyprus. While a small province compared to many others, the island is both strategically important as far as controlling the eastern portion of the Mediterranean goes and of great value to the traders of the region, and it would thus be of interest for the Empire to secure it even if it had not been a Roman province in the past.

Originally brought into the Roman Empire by Emperor Tiberius following the death of its last king, the province of Cappadocia is once more under Roman control. May it remain under Imperial control until the Day of Judgement!

Originally brought into the Roman Empire by Emperor Tiberius following the death of its last king, the province of Cappadocia is once more under Roman control. May it remain under Imperial control forevermore!

While only loosely controlled by the Roman Empire of old, it has been decided that the reincorpated region of Colchis will be elevated to the status of a full Roman province, in the hopes that the region will be a productive part of the Empire.

While only loosely controlled by the Roman Empire of old, it has been decided that the reincorpated region of Colchis will be elevated to the status of a full Roman province, in the hopes that the region will be a productive part of the Empire.

Incorporated as a Roman province by Emperor Trajan but turned into a mere protectorate by his successor Hadrian, the province of Armenia is once again considered an integral part of the Roman Empire. This region saw frequent clashes between Roman and Parthian forces in the past, and only time will tell if the Pax Romana truly will ensure a peaceful future for the region.

Incorporated as a Roman province by Emperor Trajan but turned into a mere protectorate by his successor Hadrian, the province of Armenia is once again considered an integral part of the Roman Empire. This region saw frequent clashes between Roman and Parthian forces in the past, and only time will tell if the Pax Romana truly will ensure a peaceful future for the region.

A client state of the Roman Empire in ages past, but now elevated into a full province, the region of Iberia once again answers to the Roman Empire. With proper care the people of this region may yet be turned into productive Roman citizens.

A client state of the Roman Empire in ages past, but now elevated into a full province, the region of Iberia once again answers to the Roman Empire. With proper care the people of this region may yet be turned into productive Roman citizens.

Once an ally of the Roman Empire and later a protectorate, the region of Albania has now been fully incorporated as a proper Roman province. Beset by barbarian invaders in the past, it is hoped that the Pax Romana will bring peace and stability to this region.

Once an ally of the Roman Empire and later a protectorate, the region of Albania has now been fully incorporated as a proper Roman province. Beset by barbarian invaders in the past, it is hoped that the Pax Romana will bring peace and stability to this region.

Once an important stretch of the frontier with Parthia and the later Sassanid Empire, the Roman province of Syria is once more under Imperial control. As the region controls the city of Antioch, seat of one of the Pentarchs, and is close to the holy city of Jerusalem, it will surely be of vital importance for the Empire in the future.

Once an important stretch of the frontier with Parthia and the later Sassanid Empire, the Roman province of Syria is once more under Imperial control. Considering the region is the primary source of Tyrian purple, it is doubtlessly of vital importance for the Empire to retain control of it.

The influence of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is now felt throughout the former Roman province of Africa, which has been brought back under Imperial control for the first time since its loss to the Muslim conquerors in centuries past. May it never be lost to heathen barbarians again!

The influence of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is now felt throughout the former Roman province of Africa, which has been brought back under Imperial control. No doubt both Aeneas and Scipio Africanus would find this right and proper, seeing as the city of Carthage - the ancient nemesis of Rome once ruled by Queen Dido - once again answers to Rome.

First seized from Carthage in the First Punic War, the island of Sicily is once more under proper Roman control. This island is of vital importance for anyone wishing to control the Mediterranean, considering its strategic location between the Italian Peninsula and Africa, and it will without doubt be heavily garrisoned as a result.

First seized from Carthage in the First Punic War, the island of Sicily is once more under proper Roman control. This island is of vital importance for anyone wishing to control the Mediterranean, considering its strategic location between the Italian Peninsula and Africa, and it will without doubt be heavily garrisoned as a result.

For the second time since the fall of the Western Empire, the Italian Peninsula has been liberated and restored to proper Roman rule, hopefully for good this time. The great city of Rome itself once more belongs to the Empire, and even hardened soldiers can be seen weeping as the Imperial standard flutters in the breeze from Trajan's Column.

For the second time since the fall of the Western Empire, the Italian Peninsula has been liberated and restored to proper Roman rule, hopefully for good this time. The great city of Rome itself once more belongs to the Empire, and even hardened soldiers can be seen weeping as the Imperial standard flutters in the breeze from Trajan's Column.
The Province of Corsica et Sardinia

Incorporated into the Roman Republic between the First and the Second Punic War, the islands of Corsica and Sardinia once more belong to Rome. As the islands both are of importance for merchants and offer some protection for the Italian Peninsula from naval invasions across the Western Mediterranean, there is little doubt they will play an important part in the resurgent Roman Empire.

Incorporated into the Roman Republic between the First and the Second Punic War, the islands of Corsica and Sardinia once more belong to Rome. As the islands both are of importance for merchants and offer some protection for the Italian Peninsula from naval invasions across the Western Mediterranean, there is little doubt they will play an important part in the resurgent Roman Empire.
The Province of Alpes Graiae et Poeninae

One of the smallest Roman provinces, Alpes Graiae et Poeninae sits on the border between Gaul and the Italian Peninsula. Its reincorporation into the resurgent Roman Empire might not be as impressive as that of certain other provinces might be, but Roman control restored to former Roman territory is still in the interest of the Empire.

One of the smallest Roman provinces, Alpes Graiae et Poeninae sits on the border between Gaul and the Italian Peninsula. Its reincorporation into the resurgent Roman Empire might not be as impressive as that of certain other provinces might be, but Roman control restored to former Roman territory is still in the interest of the Empire.

One of the smallest Roman provinces, Alpes Cottiae sits on the border between Gaul and the Italian Peninsula. Its reincorporation into the resurgent Roman Empire might not be as impressive as that of certain other provinces might be, but Roman control restored to former Roman territory is still in the interest of the Empire.

One of the smallest Roman provinces, Alpes Cottiae sits on the border between Gaul and the Italian Peninsula. Its reincorporation into the resurgent Roman Empire might not be as impressive as that of certain other provinces might be, but Roman control restored to former Roman territory is still in the interest of the Empire.

One of the smallest Roman provinces, Alpes Maritimae sits on the border between Gaul and the Italian Peninsula. Its reincorporation into the resurgent Roman Empire might not be as impressive as that of certain other provinces might be, but Roman control restored to former Roman territory is still in the interest of the Empire.

One of the smallest Roman provinces, Alpes Maritimae sits on the border between Gaul and the Italian Peninsula. Its reincorporation into the resurgent Roman Empire might not be as impressive as that of certain other provinces might be, but Roman control restored to former Roman territory is still in the interest of the Empire.

The former Roman province of Dalmatia has again been restored to its rightful owners in the resurgent Imperium Romanum. With the eastern shores of the Adriatic secured, there is little doubt that the Empire is growing stronger, and its attention will doubtlessly turn to other areas to bring into compliance before long.

The former Roman province of Dalmatia has again been restored to its rightful owners in the resurgent Imperium Romanum. With the eastern shores of the Adriatic secured, there is little doubt that the Empire is growing stronger, and its attention will doubtlessly turn to other areas to bring into compliance before long.

Situated along a portion of the Danube, the Roman province of Pannonia Inferior is once again under the control of the Imperium Romanum. It is hoped that the province never again will fall into the hands of barbarians.

Situated along a portion of the Danube, the Roman province of Pannonia Inferior is once again under the control of the Imperium Romanum It is hoped that the province never again will fall into the hands of barbarians.

Once the site of a meeting where Diocletian sought to deal with rising tensions in the Tetrarchy, during which he refused to return to power, Pannonia Superior once more belongs to Rome. Whether it will be the site of an important meeting again in the future will be for future historians to decide, but regardless they will record that the province was recovered by the Empire.

Once the site of a meeting where Diocletian sought to deal with rising tensions in the Tetrarchy, during which he refused to return to power, Pannonia Superior once more belongs to Rome. Whether it will be the site of an important meeting again in the future will be for future historians to decide, but regardless they will record that the province was recovered by the Empire.

Guarding a portion of the Danube and the eastern reaches of the Alps, the province of Noricum has been recovered by the Roman Empire, having suffered greatly under barbarian rule in the years since its loss. May it never be lost again.

Guarding a portion of the Danube and the eastern reaches of the Alps, the province of Noricum has been recovered by the Roman Empire, having suffered greatly under barbarian rule in the years since its loss. May it never be lost again.

Separated from Mauretania Tingitana by Emperor Claudius but later lost to the Vandals, Mauretania Caesariensis was later recovered by Belisarius in the 6th century only to be lost to the Muslim heathens during their westward expansion in the 7th century. Hopefully, it has been recovered for good this time.

Separated from Mauretania Tingitana by Emperor Claudius but later lost to the Vandals, Mauretania Caesariensis was later recovered by Belisarius in the 13th century Ab Urbe Condita only to be lost to the Muslim invaders during their westward expansion in the 15th century Ab Urbe Condita. Hopefully, it has been recovered for good this time.

Separated from Mauretania Caesariensis by Emperor Claudius and remaining at least partially under Roman control until the Muslim heathens conquered it in the early 8th century, the province of Mauretania Tingitana has at last been recovered by the Roman Empire. Considering it helps prevent outside access to the Mediterranean, it must be kept secure.

Separated from Mauretania Caesariensis by Emperor Claudius and remaining at least partially under Roman control until the Muslim conquered it in the 15th century Ab Urbe Condita, the province of Mauretania Tingitana has at last been recovered by the Roman Empire. The southern of the Pillars of Hercules once again belongs to Rome, and with it under Roman control the access to the Mediterranean can be better guarded.

The first part of Gaul to be brought under Roman rule in an age long gone, Gallia Narbonensis was where Julius Caesar readied his forces for the conquest of all of Gaul. Perhaps it will provide a valuable staging ground for future Roman conquests, too.

The first part of Gaul to be brought under Roman rule in an age long gone, Gallia Narbonensis was where Julius Caesar readied his forces for the conquest of all of Gaul. Perhaps it will provide a valuable staging ground for future Roman conquests, too.

Ceded to the Visigoths by Emperor Flavius Honorius in a failed attempt to appease them, Gallia Aquitania is once more under proper Roman control. As the region controls the western passes of the Pyrenees, it will doubtlessly be of strategic importance to Rome in the future.

Ceded to the Visigoths by Emperor Flavius Honorius in a failed attempt to appease them, Gallia Aquitania is once more under proper Roman control. As the region controls the western passes of the Pyrenees, it will doubtlessly be of strategic importance to Rome in the future.

Containing the city of Aurelianorum - the city of Aurelian, later renamed Orléans - and once the location of the last Roman remnant in Gaul, Gallia Lugdunensis has been recovered by the resurgent Imperium Romanum. May it never again be beset by barbarian invaders!

Containing the city of Aurelianorum - the city of Aurelian, later renamed Orléans - and once the location of the last Roman remnant in Gaul, Gallia Lugdunensis has been recovered by the resurgent Imperium Romanum. May it never again be beset by barbarian invaders!

Gallia Belgica is once more in Roman hands. While not the greatest part of Gaul, the Roman Empire has not forgotten that this region, too, is rightful Roman territory, and it will doubtlessly remember it in the future as well.

Gallia Belgica is once more in Roman hands. While not the greatest part of Gaul, the Roman Empire has not forgotten that this region, too, is rightful Roman territory, and it will doubtlessly remember it in the future as well.

Controlling the northern portion of several passes through the Alps and located along a stretch of the Limes Germanicus, the province of Raetia was once of great strategic importance to the Roman Empire, and it will doubtlessly be so once again now that the province has been recovered.

Controlling the northern portion of several passes through the Alps and located along a stretch of the Limes Germanicus, the province of Raetia was once of great strategic importance to the Roman Empire, and it will doubtlessly be so once again now that the province has been recovered.

Located inside an important stretch of the Limes Germanicus, the Roman province of Germania Superior saw frequent conflict in the past as barbarians assailed it in their attempts to cross deeper into Roman territory. Hopefully, the restoration of the Pax Romana will finally pacify the region.

Located inside an important stretch of the Limes Germanicus, the Roman province of Germania Superior saw frequent conflict in the past as barbarians assailed it in their attempts to cross deeper into Roman territory. Hopefully, the restoration of the Pax Romana will finally pacify the region.

Frequently assailed by Germanic tribes crossing the Rhine in the past, the province of Germania Inferior must once more be fortified to keep it in Roman hands now that it has been recovered by the resurgent Imperium Romanum. Peace, justice, and stability must be brought to the region.

Frequently assailed by Germanic tribes crossing the Rhine in the past, the province of Germania Inferior must once more be fortified to keep it in Roman hands now that it has been recovered by the resurgent Imperium Romanum. Peace, justice, and stability must be brought to the region.

Gaul, long thought forever lost to Roman rule, has submitted to the [Root.GetTitle] and been incorporated back into the Empire. The province has changed much since Caesar campaigned in this land over a thousand years ago, but at last every single independent-minded Gaulish village has been brought into compliance.

Gaul, long thought forever lost to Roman rule, has submitted to the [Root.GetTitle] and been incorporated back into the Empire. The province has changed much since Caesar campaigned in this land over a thousand years ago, but at last every single independent-minded Gaulish village has been brought into compliance.

The Roman Empire has now expanded beyond the borders it claimed even under the great Trajan. Germania, ever the bane of Roman armies, has at long last been pacified and incorporated into the Empire. The barbarian invasions of the past, and the annihilation of Varus' legions in the Battle of the Teutoburg Forest, have at last been avenged.

The Roman Empire has now expanded beyond the borders it claimed even under the great Trajan. Germania, ever the bane of Roman armies, has at long last been pacified and incorporated into the Empire. The barbarian invasions of the past, and the annihilation of Varus' legions in the Battle of the Teutoburg Forest, have at last been avenged.

The province of Dacia was relutantly abandoned by Aurelian due to the might of the Imperial legions being urgently needed elsewhere, and its recovery was long thought impossible, but now the province and its rich mines once more belong to the Roman Empire. May it never suffer the cruel touch of barbarians again.

The province of Dacia was relutantly abandoned by Aurelian due to the might of the Imperial legions being urgently needed elsewhere, and its recovery was long thought impossible, but now the province and its rich mines once more belong to the Roman Empire. May it never suffer the cruel touch of barbarians again.

The parts of the Carpathian Basin that never were part of the Roman province of Dacia have now been incorporated into the resurgent Roman Empire as a new province by the name of Transdanubia. With time, this region might become a productive part of the Empire.

The parts of the Carpathian Basin that never were part of the Roman province of Dacia have now been incorporated into the resurgent Roman Empire as a new province by the name of Transdanubia. With time, this region might become a productive part of the Empire.

While historians do not fully agree as to whether the northern Germanic tribes of Scandinavia took part in the defeat of Varus' legions or the later invasions of Roman land, there can be no doubt that civilisation at last has been brought to their lands. May this frozen place provide a boon to the Empire!

While historians do not fully agree as to whether the northern Germanic tribes of Scandinavia took part in the defeat of Varus' legions or the later invasions of Roman land, there can be no doubt that civilisation at last has been brought to their lands. May this frozen place provide a boon to the Empire!

The Land of a Thousand Lakes now belongs to Rome, and a new Imperial province has been created as a result. What value this land will provide to the Empire has yet to be determined, but even so the Romans will doubtlessly fight hard to keep it under their control.

The Land of a Thousand Lakes now belongs to Rome, and a new Imperial province has been created as a result. What value this land will provide to the Empire has yet to be determined, but even so the Romans will doubtlessly fight hard to keep it under their control.

Controlling a great portion of the eastern shore of the Baltic Sea, the new Roman province of Baltica will without a doubt benefit the Roman Empire as it brings civilisation to the northern reaches, and will in turn benefit from the Pax Romana.

Controlling a great portion of the eastern shore of the Baltic Sea, the new Roman province of Baltica will without a doubt benefit the Roman Empire as it brings civilisation to the northern reaches, and will in turn benefit from the Pax Romana.

The harsh and cold climate of the islands to the north and west of Caledonia and their seeming lack in strategic value has been such that some have questioned whether the resurgent Imperium Romanum's attention should be focused elsewhere, but the region has now been brought into compliance. Perhaps those that fail in the service of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will find themselves exiled here, should their failures not be severe enough to warrant execution.

The harsh and cold climate of the islands to the north and west of Caledonia and their seeming lack in strategic value has been such that some have questioned whether the resurgent Imperium Romanum's attention should be focused elsewhere, but the region has now been brought into compliance. Perhaps those that fail in the service of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will find themselves exiled here, should their failures not be severe enough to warrant execution.

The island of Hibernia is the latest addition to the ever-expanding domains of the Roman Empire. This land of gently rolling hills and green fields was never conquered by the old empire, but it should become a pleasant fief to govern, provided the locals do not grow too unruly and demand the restoration of their independence.

The island of Hibernia is the latest addition to the ever-expanding domains of the Roman Empire. This land of gently rolling hills and green fields was never conquered by the old empire, but it should become a pleasant fief to govern, provided the locals do not grow too unruly and demand the restoration of their independence.

Cruelly left to their own devices when the Roman garrisons abandoned the province of Britannia in the 5th century, the population of this province can at last rejoice. After suffering through centuries of darkness, the eternal light of civilisation once again shines upon Britannia. May it ever endure!

Cruelly left to their own devices when the Roman garrisons abandoned the province of Britannia in the 12th century Ab Urbe Condita, the population of this province can at last rejoice. After suffering through centuries of darkness, the eternal light of civilisation once again shines upon Britannia. May it ever endure!
The island known to the ancient Roman Empire as Manavia is now under Roman control. Considering its strategic location, it will doubtlessly be of great value to the Empire.
The island known to the ancient Roman Empire as Manavia is now under Roman control. Considering its strategic location, it will doubtlessly be of great value to the Empire.

The borders of Rome have now advanced well beyond the ancient ruins of both Hadrian's Wall and the Antonine Wall to at last include all of Caledonia. This hard and unforgiving land is the home of a peculiar breed of people, but they will be turned into productive Roman citizens yet.

The borders of Rome have now advanced well beyond the ancient ruins of both Hadrian's Wall and the Antonine Wall to at last include all of Caledonia. This hard and unforgiving land is the home of a peculiar breed of people, but they will be turned into productive Roman citizens yet.

Lusitania is once more back where it belongs, under the control of the Roman Empire. First brought into compliance by Augustus himself, the region was later lost to the Suebi, the Visigoths, and finally Muslim heathens. May Christianity and civilisation prevail, this time!

Lusitania is once more back where it belongs, under the control of the Roman Empire. First brought into compliance by Augustus himself, the region was later lost to the Suebi, the Visigoths, and finally Muslim invaders. Let civilisation prevail, this time!

Hispania Baetica has been recovered by the Roman Empire. Lost to the Visigoths, who in turn lost it to the Muslim heathens, control of the region helps ensure control of the access to the Mediterranean, which is of vital importance in order to ensure that the sea in question once more becomes the Mare Nostrum of the past.

Hispania Baetica has been recovered by the Roman Empire. Control of the region means control of the northern of the Pillars of Hercules, which helps ensure control of the access to the Mediterranean, which is of vital importance in order to ensure that the sea in question once more becomes the Mare Nostrum of the past.

Hispania Tarraconensis, containing the greater part of the Iberian Peninsula, has once more come under Roman control. It is the hope of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and all true Romans that the province never again slips from the Empire's grasp.

Hispania Tarraconensis, containing the greater part of the Iberian Peninsula, has once more come under Roman control. It is the hope of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and all true Romans that the province never again slips from the Empire's grasp.

The power and influence of the Roman Empire now extends all the way to the old province of Hispania once more. This land has suffered greatly from the constant border skirmishes waged between the Muslim invaders and the local Christians, but now it may finally know peace again as the Pax Romana settles over the peninsula.

The power and influence of the Roman Empire now extends all the way to the old province of Hispania once more. This land has suffered greatly from the constant border skirmishes waged between the followers of the Prophet and the local Galileans, but now that their influence is no more and the Pax Romana settles over the peninsula it might at last know peace.

Emperor Trajan conquered Mesopotamia from the Parthian Empire and organized it as a Roman province, but it was abandoned by his successor Hadrian just a few years later. Now the Euphrates and Tigris rivers are once again under the Roman aegis, and this time they may be there to stay.

Emperor Trajan conquered Mesopotamia from the Parthian Empire and organized it as a Roman province, but it was abandoned by his successor Hadrian just a few years later. Now the Euphrates and Tigris rivers are once again under the Roman aegis, and this time they may be there to stay.

Named for the Tyrian purple that once was produced here and that once again will be produced here, the new province of Mauretania Purpura is the latest addition to the resurgent Roman Empire. It is hoped that the people here will become productive Roman citizens, given time.

Named for the Tyrian purple that once was produced here and that once again will be produced here, the new province of Mauretania Purpura is the latest addition to the resurgent Roman Empire. It is hoped that the people here will become productive Roman citizens, given time.

Located to the south of Aegyptus, the new Roman province of Nubia helps secure a greater stretch of the Nile. Perhaps the province will one day provide as much grain for the Empire as Aegyptus itself did in ages past.

Located to the south of Aegyptus, the new Roman province of Nubia helps secure a greater stretch of the Nile. Perhaps the province will one day provide as much grain for the Empire as Aegyptus itself did in ages past.

With the incorporation of the new Imperial province of Abyssinia, the resurgent Roman Empire is in a great position to establish a stranglehold on the trade in the Red Sea, which likely will bring great wealth into its coffers. This will without a doubt make the Romans unwilling to relinquish control of the area, not that they ever prefer to let a province slip from their grasp...

With the incorporation of the new Imperial province of Abyssinia, the resurgent Roman Empire is in a great position to establish a stranglehold on the trade in the Red Sea, which likely will bring great wealth into its coffers. This will without a doubt make the Romans unwilling to relinquish control of the area, not that they ever prefer to let a province slip from their grasp...

The Arabian Peninsula, the birthplace of the Prophet Muhammad, whose successors once conquered much of the Eastern Roman Empire and the holy city of Jerusalem, is now fully under Roman control. With the proper garrisons and constant vigilance, there will hopefully not be any further heathen threats arising in this region.

The Arabian Peninsula, the birthplace of the Prophet Muhammad, whose successors once conquered much of the Eastern Roman Empire and threatened the very walls of Constantinople, is now fully under Roman control. With the proper garrisons and constant vigilance, such threats will hopefully never arise again.

The region of Media has been brought under Roman control, and an Imperial province with the same name has been created. Control of the southern side of the Caspian Sea and many of the mountain passes in the region might prove important in the years to come, and even if it does not it is doubtful that the Roman Empire would see fit to abandon the province.

Media, from whence Cyrus the Great - the founder of the Achaemid Empire that Alexander the Great conquered - came, has now been brought under Roman control, and an Imperial province with the same name has been created. The Roman Empire will doubtlessly be unwilling to let this region slip from its grasp.

The ancient city of Susa, where Alexander the Great once held a mass wedding, and the surrounding region has been incorporated into the resurgent Roman Empire. A new province - Susiana - has been created as a result, and will hopefully provide great value to the Empire in the years to come.

The ancient city of Susa, where Alexander the Great once held a mass wedding, and the surrounding region has been incorporated into the resurgent Roman Empire. A new province - Susiana - has been created as a result, and will hopefully provide great value to the Empire in the years to come.

The site of the original capital of the Sassanid Empire, the fierce rival of the Eastern Roman Empire prior to the rise of the Muslim heathens, the new province of Persis will perhaps prove valuable to the Roman Empire in the years to come, provided it is kept safe from those that would see darkness and barbarity thrive there again.

The site of the original capital of the Sassanid Empire, the fierce rival of the Eastern Roman Empire prior to the Muslim conquests, the new province of Persis will perhaps prove valuable to the Roman Empire in the years to come, provided it is kept safe from those that would see darkness and barbarity thrive there again.

Parthia, which named an ancient, hated enemy of Rome, has been brought into compliance, and an Imperial province with the same name has been created. The pacification of this region will hopefully benefit the Imperium Romanum in the centuries to come.

Parthia, which named an ancient, hated enemy of Rome, has been brought into compliance, and an Imperial province with the same name has been created. The pacification of this region will hopefully benefit the Imperium Romanum in the centuries to come.

The new Imperial province of Carmania will help secure access to the Persian Gulf as well as the southern passes into India, both of which doubtlessly will benefit the Roman Empire. May civilisation prevail in this formerly barbarian region!

The new Imperial province of Carmania will help secure access to the Persian Gulf as well as the southern passes into India, both of which doubtlessly will benefit the Roman Empire. May civilisation prevail in this formerly barbarian region!

Situated on the western side of several important mountain passes providing access into India, the new Imperial province of Arachosia will be of great strategic value to the resurgent Roman Empire. Historians will doubtlessly consider its incorporation into the Empire a wise move by [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Situated on the western side of several important mountain passes providing access into India, the new Imperial province of Arachosia will be of great strategic value to the resurgent Roman Empire. Historians will doubtlessly consider its incorporation into the Empire a wise move by [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Conquered by Alexander the Great through a combination of military force and diplomacy, and the homeland of his wife Roxana, the region of Bactria has now come under the control of the Roman Empire, and the creation of a new Imperial province by the same name has been proclaimed. May this land remain Roman forevermore!

Conquered by Alexander the Great through a combination of military force and diplomacy, and the homeland of his wife Roxana, the region of Bactria has now come under the control of the Roman Empire, and the creation of a new Imperial province by the same name has been proclaimed. May this land remain Roman forevermore!

Transoxiana has been incorporated into the resurgent Roman Empire as a new Imperial province, bringing with it control over several important mountain passes useful to both Imperial armies and merchants trading along the Silk Road. The Pax Romana will ensure peace, justice, and stability in the region, come what may.

Transoxiana has been incorporated into the resurgent Roman Empire as a new Imperial province, bringing with it control over several important mountain passes useful to both Imperial armies and merchants trading along the Silk Road. The Pax Romana will ensure peace, justice, and stability in the region, come what may.

The resurgent Roman Empire now controls the portion of the steppes between the Caucasus Mountains and the Don and Volga rivers. While not a very civilised or wealthy region, the Roman presence here will help ensure that no potential threat arising in the steppes has easy access to the Black Sea or Asia Minor.

The resurgent Roman Empire now controls the portion of the steppes between the Caucasus Mountains and the Don and Volga rivers. While not a very civilised or wealthy region, the Roman presence here will help ensure that no potential threat arising in the steppes has easy access to the Black Sea or Asia Minor.

The Roof of the World now belongs to Rome, proving that not even the tallest mountains are beyond the grasp of the Imperium Romanum. While an inhospitable place, the region is of great importance when it comes to securing a number of mountain passes providing access to India, China, Persia, and the Tarim Basin, and as a result it will likely be of strategic importance to Rome in the years to come.

The Roof of the World now belongs to Rome, proving that not even the tallest mountains are beyond the grasp of the Imperium Romanum. While an inhospitable place, the region is of great importance when it comes to securing a number of mountain passes providing access to India, China, Persia, and the Tarim Basin, and as a result it will likely be of strategic importance to Rome in the years to come.

The western part of the Tarim Basin has been brought into the resurgent Roman Empire, ensuring Roman control of several important trading cities and mountain passes. Fortifying the region would likely be prudent, to ensure it never is lost to barbarians.

The western part of the Tarim Basin has been brought into the resurgent Roman Empire, ensuring Roman control of several important trading cities and mountain passes. Fortifying the region would likely be prudent, to ensure it never is lost to barbarians.

The eastern part of the Tarim Basin has been brought into the resurgent Roman Empire, bringing many important trading cities under Roman control. Control over this region will help ensure that the interests of Rome can be safeguarded in both China and Persia.

The eastern part of the Tarim Basin has been brought into the resurgent Roman Empire, bringing many important trading cities under Roman control. Control over this region will help ensure that the interests of Rome can be safeguarded in both China and Persia.

The Roman Empire now controls the Indus and a stretch of land beyond it reaching all the way to the southern bank of the supposedly sacred Ganges. This land of tigers and elephants will provide valuable resources and manpower to Rome, and will greatly benefit from the Pax Romana.

The might of Rome can now be felt further east than the easternmost borders of Alexander the Great's empire, as the Indus and a great stretch of land beyond it has been brought into compliance. This land of tigers and elephants will provide valuable resources and manpower to Rome, and will greatly benefit from the Pax Romana.

The southern portion of the Indian subcontinent and the islands beyond have been incorporated into the resurgent Imperium Romanum. As all maritime trade between the east and the Roman heartland must pass by the tip of India and the ports of the region, this will doubtlessly bring plentiful wealth to Rome and to [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

The southern portion of the Indian subcontinent and the islands beyond have been incorporated into the resurgent Imperium Romanum. As all maritime trade between the east and the Roman heartland must pass by the tip of India and the ports of the region, this will doubtlessly bring plentiful wealth to Rome and to [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

The furthest reaches of India have been brought under Roman control, bringing with it control of the supposedly sacred Ganges. This populous region might provide a boon to the Empire, provided the locals can be civilised and converted.

The furthest reaches of India have been brought under Roman control. It is said that Alexander the Great wept because there was no world left to conquer even though he never reached this far east, but the Romans weep not, instead considering whether they can progress yet further beyond.

The entirety of the Indian subcontinent has been brought into the Imperium Romanum, bringing with it great riches. With proper guidance, the people of the region will embrace both civilisation and Christianity, and thus become productive Roman citizens.

The entirety of the Indian subcontinent has been brought into the Imperium Romanum, bringing with it great riches. With proper guidance, the people of the region will embrace civilisation, and thus become productive Roman citizens.

All of China north of the Yangtze River now belongs to Rome, with doubtlessly displeases anyone that would claim the Mandate of Heaven. The knowledge found in this land will now benefit Rome, and possibly help ensure Roman conquests elsewhere.

All of China north of the Yangtze River now belongs to Rome, with doubtlessly displeases anyone that would claim the Mandate of Heaven. The knowledge found in this land will now benefit Rome, and possibly help ensure Roman conquests elsewhere.

All of China south of the Yangtze River is now part of the Imperium Romanum. The Pax Romana will help bring peace, justice, and stability to this region, refuting all claims that only one who possesses the Mandate of Heaven may bring about such things.

All of China south of the Yangtze River is now part of the Imperium Romanum. The Pax Romana will help bring peace, justice, and stability to this region, refuting all claims that only one who possesses the Mandate of Heaven may bring about such things.

China, the so-called "Middle Kingdom", has been fully brought into the Roman fold. Once the seat of imperial dynasties that believed themselves superior to all and viewed even the glory of Rome as nothing but barbarian posturing, the wealth, resources, and people of this region will now contribute to Roman greatness and further Roman triumphs.

China, the so-called "Middle Kingdom", has been fully brought into the Roman fold. Once the seat of imperial dynasties that believed themselves superior to all and viewed even the glory of Rome as nothing but barbarian posturing, the wealth, resources, and people of this region will now contribute to Roman greatness and further Roman triumphs.

Named after the beauty of the main island, the new Roman province of Insula Pulchra might prove to be of great strategic importance for any Roman fleets operating to the east of China, and it is quite possible that many prominent Roman families will seek to secure an estate on the island so that they may appreciate its beauty in person.

Named after the beauty of the main island, the new Roman province of Insula Pulchra might prove to be of great strategic importance for any Roman fleets operating to the east of China, and it is quite possible that many prominent Roman families will seek to secure an estate on the island so that they may appreciate its beauty in person.

The Korean Peninsula has now been incorporated into the resurgent Roman Empire. As always, new lands bring more riches and more manpower into the Empire, and the rather populous region will likely prove to be quite the boon for the Empire in the future.

The Korean Peninsula has now been incorporated into the resurgent Roman Empire. As always, new lands bring more riches and more manpower into the Empire, and the rather populous region will likely prove to be quite the boon for the Empire in the future.

The Land of the Rising Sun has been brought under Roman control at last, bringing the light of civilisation to the furthest east. Without doubt, historians will speak highly of this achievement in the centuries and millennia to come.

The Land of the Rising Sun has been brought under Roman control at last, bringing the light of civilisation to the furthest east. Without doubt, historians will speak highly of this achievement in the centuries and millennia to come.

May [Root.GetSheHe] be more fortunate than Augustus and better than Trajan. Empty words and wishful thinking, once, but now nothing but the truth.\nThose unfortunate enough to have lived through the black days when barbarians sacked Rome at will or the Arab invaders swept in from the desert would not have dared dream of this day. All of the old provinces have been reclaimed and the Empire now stretches farther than it has in many centuries.\nCountless people from all races and creeds all across Europe are celebrating this momentous occasion and men and women in both Rome and Constantinople are weeping tears of joy. It will be a challenge to keep an empire of this scale together, but it must be done, lest the world plunge into yet another dark age of ignorance and barbarity bereft of Rome's guiding light.

May [Root.GetSheHe] be more fortunate than Augustus and better than Trajan. Empty words and wishful thinking, once, but now nothing but the truth.\nThose unfortunate enough to have lived through the black days when barbarians sacked Rome at will or the Arab invaders swept in from the desert would not have dared dream of this day. All of the old provinces have been reclaimed and the Empire now stretches farther than it has in many centuries.\nBy shedding the weight of the dead god of the Galileans and re-embracing the Olympians the Empire of Caesar and Augustus has risen from its ashes. It will be a challenge to keep an empire of this scale together, but it must be done, lest the world plunge into yet another dark age of ignorance and barbarity bereft of Rome's guiding light.
